pullRequest.title: KEYCLOAK-14529 Signed and Encrypted ID Token Support : RSA-OAEP-256
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR is for KEYCLOAK-14529
Documentation PR is at keycloak/keycloak-documentation#963

nodes.bodyText:
4.3.  Key Encryption with RSAES OAEP of JWA states that

"alg" Param Value : RSA-OAEP-256
Key Management Algorithm : RSAES OAEP using SHA-256 and MGF1 with SHA-256

[A.2.  Key Management Algorithm Identifier Cross-Reference of JWA](A.2.  Key Management Algorithm Identifier Cross-Reference) stats that

JWE : RSA-OAEP-256
JCA : RSA/ECB/OAEPWithSHA-256AndMGF1Padding & MGF1ParameterSpec.SHA256

I think RSA-OAEP-256 use SHA-256 for both the main digest and the MGF1 digest.
I'm not sure
return new RsaKeyEncryption256JWEAlgorithmProvider("RSA/ECB/OAEPWithSHA-256AndMGF1Padding")
can instanciate the provider for satisfying RSA-OAEP-256. (might be use SHA-256 for the main digest and SHA-1 for the MGF1 digest?).
